intro: Cassebeeria lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf cassia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are dispersed by wind or animals.
